intro: Calophysa ciliata, commonly known as the hairy calophysa, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic and edible plants. The plant is characterized by its finely hairy stems and leaves with a distinctive, feathery appearance. Its small, white flowers are clustered in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Calophysa ciliata is often found in moist, open habitats such as prairies and woodland edges.
